public class VerticalScrollBar
extends ScrollBar

  • Constructor Details

    • VerticalScrollBar

      public VerticalScrollBar​(Scrollable scrollable)
      Constructor of the HorizontalScrollBar. Sets the height to a constant, because this should never change.

  • Method Details

    • getSliderWidth

      public static int getSliderWidth()
      Returns:
      the (static final) var for the width of the scrollbar's slider.

    • getScrollBarWidth

      public static int getScrollBarWidth()
      Returns:
      the (static final) var for the width of the scrollbar.

    • updateDimensions

      public void updateDimensions()
      Calculate the dimensions of this scrollbar and its slider
      Specified by:
      updateDimensions in class ScrollBar

    • getSliderStartY

      public int getSliderStartY()
      Used to get the starting y-coordinate of the slider. Can also be used as the down most boundary which the slider cannot cross.
      Returns:
      the most down valid y-coordinate of the slider.

    • getSliderStartX

      public int getSliderStartX()
      Used to get the x-coordinate of the slider.
      Returns:
      the left most valid x-coordinate of the slider.

    • getMaxSliderHeight

      public int getMaxSliderHeight()
      Used to calculate the maximum height the slider of this scrollbar can have, based on the total height of the scrollbar and the buffer.
      Returns:
      the maximum slider height (should always be positive).

    • handleMouseEvent

      public void handleMouseEvent​(int id, int x, int y, int clickCount)
      Handle a mouse event on this vertical scrollbar
      Specified by:
      handleMouseEvent in class ScrollBar
      Parameters:
      id - The id of the mouse event
      x - The x coordinate of the mouse event
      y - The y coordinate of the mouse event
      clickCount - The click count of the mouse event

    • calcMaxOffset

      public int calcMaxOffset()
      Calculates the maximum valid offset based on the heights of the contents of the scrollable.
      Specified by:
      calcMaxOffset in class ScrollBar
      Returns:
      the maximum amount of pixels the objects can be moved.

    • getContentHeight

      public int getContentHeight()
      Returns:
      the height of the content of the scrollable

    • getOffset

      public int getOffset()
      Returns:
      the yOffset of the scrollable

      public void setOffset​(int offset)
      Parameters:
      offset - the new YOffset of the scrollable

    • getAvailableHeight

      public int getAvailableHeight()
      Returns:

      Used to get the top boundary which the slider cannot cross.
      Specified by:

      Specified by:

      Parameters:

    • getSliderStart

      public int getSliderStart()
      Description copied from class: ScrollBar
      Used to get the boundaries which the slider cannot cross.
      Specified by:
      getSliderStart in class ScrollBar
      Returns:
      the start y coordinate of the slider

    • calculateSliderHeight

      public int calculateSliderHeight()
      The height of the scrollbarSlider is dependant of the height of the scrollable and the height of its content.
      Returns:
      the height of the slider

    • calculateSliderY

      public int calculateSliderY()
      Calculates the position of the scrollbar slider. Automatically updates when the user presses keys.
      Returns:
      the new y-coordinate of the slider.

    • setBoundaries

      public void setBoundaries()
      Sets scrollbar properties using the dimensions of the scrollable. Needed when user resizes the window.
      Specified by:
      setBoundaries in class ScrollBar
